programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Now calling minor league games in New Orleans, Jim is up for the major leagues in Atlanta; he competes against Raj, a likable young announcer; Charles works on the podcast despite Brockmire's antics; a friend from Morristown stops by for a visit.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Despite Jim's protests, Charles needs the night off for his birthday; Jim attempts to throw him a party, but things quickly get out of hand; tensions arise when Jim shows up at Charles' birthday dinner and meets his judgmental family.

programme.desc: Jim and Uribe go on an epic bender; Charles discovers a sad truth about Brockmire; when announcing with Raj, Brockmire has a few too many drinks.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Jim faces his dysfunctional family at his father's funeral; he struggles to mend his broken relationship with his sister; Brockmire must make peace with someone from his past.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Jules visits Jim, who gives her a tour of New Orleans; they reconnect for an evening, but have trouble figuring out the new terms of their relationship.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Jim takes a new gig as an Atlanta major league announcer; Charles focuses on the new direction his career might take; confronted with the truth about a legendary announcer, Jim attempts to do the right thing in the most Brockmire-way possible.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: After Jim ends up in the hospital, Charles has an intervention to stop Brockmire's destructive habits; in attendance are a rag-tag group of friends and enemies from Brockmire's past; Jim meets a dangerous new friend.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Jim goes on a bender with his new nihilistic friend, Elle, who pushes him towards a new level of destruction; Brockmire ends up in the hospital again and finally takes rehab seriously; Charles approaches Jim with a new opportunity.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: As Brockmire deals with his newfound sobriety, he is introduced as the new announcer for the Oakland Athletics with his co-announcer and former softball star Gabby Taylor.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Brockmire struggles to accept that Jules' new boyfriend is his good friend.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: While dealing with a case of broadcaster's anxiety that makes it hard to remember the count, Brockmire faces threats from his predecessor, Matt "The Bat" Hardesty; Brockmire prays to God for the first time.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Brockmire's mother, who abandoned him and his sister at a young age, comes to town and challenges his relationship with his sister.

programme.desc: Brockmire urges Charles to leave a toxic relationship; Charles is appalled by Gus' producing skills; Brockmire becomes infatuated with Matt Hardesty's nurse.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Brockmire goes out of his way to be a good friend when Gabby discovers she is pregnant and finds her wife cheating on her.

programme.title: Brockmire
programme.desc: Brockmire deals with sobriety-induced impotence and Matt's declining health; his AA sponsor reminds Brockmire that he needs to find a higher power if he wants his anxiety gone.

programme.desc: Brockmire and Gabby finally get a chance to call their first regular season MLB game for Oakland, but are confronted by protestors who are disciples of bigot Art Newlie.
